{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3720111,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-21T09:41:29.209Z","cooked":"

I’m taking AP Research this year, and I am keen on researching something robotics-related. I am a programmer/electrical guy on my team, but I wouldn’t mind doing something more mechanical-related.

I had an idea of using RF to see the viability of training a robot to avoid defense robots (in an academic setting, where I have access to locations of both bots).

Do you have any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-08-22T19:38:51.739Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":440,"readers_count":439,"score":268.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505501,"topic_slug":"ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics/505501/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3720380,"name":"Roxxy S","username":"Roxxybotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/cdc98d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-21T16:58:21.494Z","cooked":"

You could research something like whether team performance is linked to other factors such as funding, mentor experience, access to resources, location, etc. Or you could build a fully autonomous minibot and mainly focus on vision and software.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-08-21T16:58:21.494Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":387,"readers_count":386,"score":162.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505501,"topic_slug":"ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics","display_username":"Roxxy S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75839,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Multitool"},"post_url":"/t/ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics/505501/2","custom_user_title":"Multitool","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3720516,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-21T18:57:23.928Z","cooked":"

How exactly would you use RF to do that? You should also keep in mind that any use of wireless communication, especially RF, is going to be illegal in competition; so I’m not sure how applicable that would be.

In context, RF is more likely to be random forests than radio frequency. (It’s even more likely to be a typo for reinforcement learning than an abbreviation for radio frequency, IMO.)

I understand that FRC wasn’t mentioned, but given that this is a forum primarily for FIRST, I thought it might be useful to mention if they didn’t already have that knowledge. If it’s not applicable in this case, then they can gloss over it. If it is, it might better inform their choices - one outcome being neutral, one being positive.

Sokoloff is probably also right about reinforcement learning looking at the context here, if that’s the case I believe there are some datasets on roboflow that might prove useful to OP if they care to investigate more.

To be honest, I have no idea…Is it illegal though? Wasn’t 604 running some particle filter on their computer and sending data back to the roborio? What is the issue here?

Regardless of whether this is illegal, as pointed out, I am fine with only using this in an academic setting and not in competition

The specific thing that’s illegal would be radio frequency. I think if you only had some sort of receiver that might be allowed (very unsure about that) but a transmitter definitely wouldn’t be. Again, I’m not quite sure that’s what you meant my RF, so if it’s not feel free to ignore this.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-08-22T16:26:34.537Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":76.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505501,"topic_slug":"ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64351,"username":"GronkBaby","name":"Emil","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics/505501/9","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3721220,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-22T16:46:50.424Z","cooked":"

Specifically the rules you want to look at are:

R702 Communicate with the ROBOT with the specified radio. 1 Vivid Hosting wireless bridge (P/N: VH-109), that has been configured with the appropriate encryption key for your team number at each event, is the only permitted device for communicating to and from the ROBOT during the MATCH. Events held in China and Chinese Taipei are the exceptions to this rule and must use an OpenMesh (P/N: OM5P-AN or OM5P-AC) radio.

R706 Don’t bypass the ARENA network. All signals must originate from the OPERATOR CONSOLE and be transmitted to the ROBOT via the ARENA Ethernet network.

R707 Limited wireless allowed. The only forms of wireless communication that may be used to communicate to, from, or within the ROBOT, include
A. those required per R702 and R706
B. tags used for location detection systems if provided by the event
C. RFID or NFC systems used exclusively within the ROBOT

Devices that employ signals in the visual spectrum (e.g. cameras) and non-RF sensors that don’t receive human-originated commands (e.g. “beam break” sensors or IR sensors on the ROBOT used to detect FIELD elements) are not wireless communication devices and thus this rule doesn’t apply.

Thus, even a passive RF receiver would be prohibited.

I think this has been slightly explored by this post?

Does the environment a team is located in correlate with EPA? CD-Media: Papers
This is a research paper I made about the relation & correlations between environmental factors (such as school funding, the number of industry & scientific employees, etc) and EPA! This is an observation study so it doesn’t really talk about cause & effect, more just the correlations between the variables! Here is the research paper! Research Paper.pdf (1.1 MB) Why anonymous? Happy reading!

But it does have some small issues and honestly it would be great to see more research into this area anyways!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-08-25T07:25:14.719Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":72.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505501,"topic_slug":"ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ap-research-ideas-related-to-robotics/505501/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3722978,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-25T16:14:40.802Z","cooked":"
GronkBaby:

viability of training a robot

You seemed to discount this in favor of a suggested project to analyze resources available to a team. But if you want to consider software, vision and steering a robot, I suggest a possibly somewhat practical application of a robot learning to dock to the human player feeder station. In FRC competition successful docking could depend on robot capabilities (drive train for example), the human, what team the human is on (check for faces to find humans and check the shirts to determine the team), where the human is, and more. The robot could learn and additional external scouting data could be added to the learning data set.

Thanks I appreciate it! My current plan is to use MapleSim (keep in mind I have VERY limited knowledge how RF learning works) to simulate a defense robot and I can control an offense robot or create a simple algorithm for how the offense robot wishes to get to its destination (I prefer the latter since it will stop the AI from overfitting). Once it works with the simulator, I will probably test it on real robots. At that point, if I need any help I will def hop on the PV discord
